712602f-b.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712602f-b.text:
(1)
East 40th Street, north side, west from, but not including First
Ave. Note on the right, the retaining wall1 on top of which is Pros-
pect Place, (Tudor City).
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, slightly westward.
April 8, 1936.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712608f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - 1st Avenue
712608f-a.text:
(1)
40th Street, north side, west from clearing between First and
Second Avenues, seen from a sllght elevation. The nearest
remalning house is 313 East 40th Street. In the right back-
ground may be seen the skeleton of the Daily News Building
under construction at 220 East 42nd Street,and in the far
background the half-completed Lefcourt Colonial Building
at Madison Avenue and 41st Street.
AAugust 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same,seen from the ground a little f4rther west.
August 16, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712605f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712605f-a.text:
324-328 East 40th Street, (rear view) south side, between First and
Second Aves., as seen from clearance on the north side of 39th Street.
Proninent building shown, is the Woodstock Tower (320 East 42nd Street), a
unit of Tudor City.
September 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
PO REE ODUCTIONS.

707600f-c.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 40th St.
707600f-c.text:
(1)
First Avenue, at and adjoining N.W. corner of 40th Street, after
the demolition of the buildings on First Avenue, during the
progress of the Tudor City development. Nos. 1-13 Prospect
Place, up on the hill, still stand, presenting their rear to
the observer.
March 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, a year later.
March 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 2, from a different angle.
March 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707603f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 40th St.
707603f-a.text:
701-719 Firet Avenue at 40th Street, beiag dewolished for con.
struction of Tudor City.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.  April, 1926.
NTEE7  1i.G.S 1aC0
PUBLCLIBRARY

712603f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - 1st Avenue
712603f-a.text:
40th Street, north side, at First Avenue, showing No. 351 and the
eastern end of Prospect Place at the top of the embankment.
This was taken before demolition for Tudor City began.
May 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712607f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - 1st Avenue
712607f-a.text:
(1)
40th Street, north side, east from the clearing at 315-329
East 40th Street, between Second and First Avenues, showing part of
the Tudor City development.
August 16, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, east from but not including Second Ave.
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A view northward across clearance between 40th and 41st Streets, and
showing the Woodstock Tower (320 East 42nd Street) overshadowing the Essex
House (32S East 41st Street): both units of Tudor City.
August 16, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712601f.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712601f.text:
East 40th Street, between the East River and First Avenue,
showing the chimneys atop the Edison Company electrio power plant.
1939
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTIONS
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
'Portrait of N. Y.' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

712606f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712606f-a.text:
East 40th Street, south side, west from (No. 338), but not including
Firet Ave.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707602f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 40th St. E.
707602f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, from East 41st to 40th Streets. Buildings shown
are a portion of the New York Edison Co. Plant.
Ootober 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707601f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 40th St.
707601f-a.text:
First Ave., west side, north from and including East 40th Street.
Prominent buildings shown are known as (Tudor City).
About 1929.
Ewing Oalloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712604f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
712604f-a.text:
East 40th Street, west from First Avenue. At the
right is the retaining wall of Tudor City. This is
built on a bluff that was formerly known as Corcor-
an's Roost. In the background are the Lefcourt-Col-
onial, Lincoln and Chanin Buildings.
July 23, 1939
October 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPUODUCTION1
